user_review: Ordered delivery from Foiegwa for brunch through CHKPLZ. Just an FYI; CHKPLZ has partnered up with the EVA ride sharing company to handle their deliveries.Used to go to this place quite often for brunch, before this indoor world party began...On the menu:* Chicken & Waffles (Kentucky-style fried chicken, waffles, maple syrup)* Double Cheeseburger (Caramelized onions, Porto demi-glace sauce, brioche bun, fries) (IInhaled the burger before I got to take a photo )I'm sorry, but this place is still the king of Chicken and Waffles to me.Massive waffles, baked to crunchy perfection, while retaining the perfect consistency on the inside. Equally massive, crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside pieces of chicken. Once you cover it up with the delicious maple syrup, everything disappears from your plate within minutes. I would even dare to say that the Chicken and Waffles dish is large enough to be shared by two people, provided that you're not starving.For the cheeseburger; a perfectly grilled beef patty, which is still partially pink on the inside, covered with cheese and Porto sauce, stuffed between sweet brioche buns and with a side of caramelized onions; it's a perfectly sweet mess of a burger. Throw the fries into the mixture of all the sauces and enjoy!Instagram: @foiegwa

This review is gonna be for breakfast and drinks since that's what I've had so far. HOLY COW this place is amazing I've been struggling to find a good brunch spot for a while and this place really does it. There's usually a line around the block for this place but to my surprise when you walk in you give your name and they text you when your tables ready. Came in this morning and for once didn't get eggs benny. I decided to get French toast with homade whip cream and in-house butter. Amazing not to sweet and definitely big enough to keep me full.My friend did get the eggs benny on ham and the egg and hollandaise was to die for a really rich and creamy flavour almost of if the eggs were picked in butter. The house potatoes are great and I love that the skin is left on and sprinkled with sea salt. Next time I'm here I'm coming for those blueberry ricotta pancakes

Coming to Foiegwa for brunch is probably one of my better decision-making moments in life. If you plan on coming here for brunch on a weekend, be prepared for a wait, because the food is THAT good. A summary of what we ordered: - Braised Beef Chipotle Eggs Benedict and Hollandaise Sauce - Scrambled Eggs, Black Truffle and Bordelaise Sauce - Latte- Ice Cream (side) The eggs benedict was spectacular. I added a side of Foie Gras ($10) and did not regret it. The dish came with a side of apple sauce, sliced tomato, and potatoes. The braised beef was sweet and tangy, which paired well with the creamy yolk. This already creamy bite becomes enhanced with the side of foie gras I opted for. Each bite was very buttery and rich. You definitely are satisfied by the end of it. The scrambled eggs were silky, soft, and divinely rich. The truffle is definitely present in this dish. They make it quite bland, so you can preferentially add salt. You eat it with the provided slices of crostini, and BAM, it's a bite of heaven. I really enjoyed this dish the most. It tasted very unique and you really savour each bite, because it is THAT good. We got a side of ice cream, which is just your typical soft serve vanilla in a cup. It's a great way to finish your brunch! The service here was very friendly, and I very much recommend this spot when in Montreal!

Foiegwa is one of those Montreal restaurants you always see on Instagram stories and posts and you instantly HAVE to try it.My friend and I went there on a Friday morning for brunch. The waitress was very welcoming, knew her menu very well and offered us a special available that day.The restaurant itself, although small, is beautiful. They have plants everywhere, a huge mirror wall and caricatures of celebrities everywhere on the wall. Heck, even the bathroom is beautiful!I started with an oat-milk latte which came with a little heart designed in it. The latte itself was insanely good!I ordered the smoked salmon benedict eggs. The plate came with potatoes, a small portion of apple-cinnamon jam or something like that, 2 slices of tomato. The food itself was absolutely delicious. Everything from the egg, the potatoes was full of flavours and felt fresh. My only issue is the price. The portions were small for the price I paid (20$ plate). Despite that, I would definitely recommend this place because the food is just delicious and the service was lovely!

Honestly this place is so good. We were lucky enough not to have to wait a long time to sit down, but the waits can be pretty bad.The food is heavy so keep that in mind, it's not a light brunch spot. The best things here are the fried chicken and waffles so definitely don't miss out on that. I'm gluten free so the options aren't plenty, that's why I have it four stars. Otherwise so good and great vibe.

I come here for they're signature dishes, the truffle pasta, the burger and tartare. You can't go wrong with of those. The cocktails are also amazing, the mixologist on point, with original selection on the menu. The only thing I would say, is o wish they had more signature dishes!!! More new items, but that might be selfish on my part. I also feel that the staff truly but truly cares about your happiness and is extremely attentive. My friend returned a dish after thinking she liked truffles and they didn't charge her, brought her a new dish without being rude or condescending. This is rare in the city for restaurants. This is why for this restaurants deserves a 5/5.

Little hardo about not being able to accommodate food allergies/modifications etc but the food is consistent and good and staff is pretty nice so definitely good experience. Tough when gluten free but happens. Service definitely slow so just keep that in mind. For sure not New York style but enjoyable overall

If this was my first experience I would have given it a three out of five but because I know what to expect I was truly disappointed. The service has always been impeccable and super understanding. They will always do everything to accommodate you. However I find a brunch place with a coffee that's not very good takes away from the whole experience no matter how good the food is. I find their coffee way too bitter and that leaves a burnt taste. We both sent it back but even the second round tasted awful maybe it's an acquired taste but being with a Italian Friend who knows her coffee this was a strikeout. After having a conversation with the service manager they have received some comments about their coffee being bitter. So I hope they resolve this issue because this could be a deal-breaker for some of us. I did suggest maybe having a different Bean or roast that they can grind separately for those that find this coffee horrible.Being a huge fan of mushrooms we decided to share the mushroom omelette and tartine. The omelette was 5 out of 5 I personally found it perfect my friend did find it a little bit under salted. The mushroom definitely brought out the flavour and we can always add salt if needed. I always prefer my dish under salted then over salted. The tartine would have been a 6 out of 5 if the bread wasn't burnt and I'm not just saying over-cooked there was a thick layer of charcoal under. We didn't give it back because the flavours were just fantastic. It's a must have if you love mushrooms and even if you don't it's still a must-have. If this was my first time I would definitely give it a second chance, this wasn't my first time and it won't be my last I'm definitely coming back but I really hope they do something about the coffee.

Foiegwa was one of my favorite restaurants in Montreal. When you walk in the restaurant it's a nice cozy feeling. My waitress was very friendly and helpful on deciding  on the many great options they have on the menu. The truffle pasta is a must! The portion size of the truffle pasta is good for sharing. I tried several plates and everything is made fresh. This place is great for brunch and Sunday dinners.

I heard a lot about this place before coming and it is good as I've been told. Since I was alone I sat at the counter and watched the bartender mix various coffee concoctions and cocktails. She was very informative about the menu and surrounding area, she even corrected me on my French  I ordered Mochaccino Expresso and Eggs Benedict & Créme Fleurette Hollandaise w/ Braised Beef Chipotle. She described my meal before order and it came out absolutely as she originally informed me. It was delicious and I'm not a fan of coleslaw but I ate it. I watched her make Shamrock Coffee several times so I had to order one, Yes good! I'll be back!

Seriously people why?! This place was NEVER on my to-do list. The hype from the getgo had me like "No effin way". So why on earth did I bother at all, you ask? Well, because my friend Kalli, the birthday girl, wanted to try it for brunch. So we came at 9:30 on a Sunday to beat the line (smart choice that worked). The verdict: not so upset I came and I tried, but so not worth the hype and totally worth skipping. Wayyyyy wayyyyy wayyyyy overpriced. Ridiculously so. And how they managed to turn that huge a$$ diner into a tiny closet of a bathroom eating space is beyond me. What did you do with all that space folks?? (This place used to be a Belle Province that was HUGE). My friends ventured that they enlarged the kitchen (to focus on the cuisine, of course), but with what came out of the kitchen I would like to suggest maybe they need an even bigger kitchen. Their mimosas were ridiculously expensive (60$$$ per bottle) and served with prosecco (not even champagne). Though at least our waitress was excellent in refilling our glasses, so at least the service for the mimosas made up for the price and quality. I had the duck confit and goat cheese omelet. It was good, but cheap on the duck, for a 20$ plate you could at least make sure you highlight the main ingredient a bit better. It did have a satisfying amount of goat cheese though, so kudos for that. The breakfast potatoes here are nasty. They look like they should be delicious, crispy exterior, fluffy interior, but they were dry overcooked and disgusting. I'm Irish-Cdn and I left most of the potatoes uneaten.. "You know it's bad when..." , totally unacceptable for a 20$ plate. Someone please teach your cooks how to make potatoes.The bacon I ordered on the side (3 slices) was perfectly cooked and if I were to have to come here again, I might just order sides of bacon and skip the rest. Birthday girl ordered a scrambled egg dish that looked like oatmeal covered in chia seeds with a dark sauce drizzled on it, (it wasn't at all that, but that's what it looked like) and she insisted she liked it, but it looked nasty. Our dude friends ordered eggs n sausage with the added Foie Gras for 10$ extra for a piece as big as my thumb (jacked price much?!). They enjoyed, but I found the Foie Gras just ok, creamy and likely perfectly cooked, but bland. Service was generally good, not fantastic, not bad at all, a coupla wierd moments, but nothing to make or break the impression of the place. For the prices here I would have expected much more client-centered care, which is not the case, not professional waitstaff material, just ur run of the mill student-waiter type. Oh and 1 tiny bathroom for everyone to share, there was always, always someone waiting for it.So yah, overall don't even bother. People are suckers to believe the hype about this place. There's much better to discover in Mtl and this ain't it.

Service (serve are nice and welcoming)10/10 Food(I had chicken with waffle, the bread chicken meat is dry and the waffle basically soak into the syrup which I would prefer both chicken and waffle to be somewhat crispy instead.)5/10Drink (smoothie of the moment was made with orange peach pineapple but all I can't really tell what's inside tbh)6/10  I guess it's just one of the place where you should go for once and take photos for ins then never go back again

Possibly our favorite meal in Montreal. We had to take an Uber there but it was totally worth it.Cocktails: nice and strong. I had the Maple Old Fashioned and it was good.Bone marrow: small snack but comes with an amazing, almost Asian-inspired brown sauce that we soaked up with the complimentary bread. So yummy.Spaghetti with black truffle: Yelpers are totally correct. This is one dish to die for. So fragrant and the spaghetti is al dente.Burger with foie gras: so many fries! The foie gras was small but had great flavor. The burger was cheesy and messy, everything you'd want in a good burger.Panna cotta: a good light finish to the heavy meal.Service can be slow sometimes but we enjoyed our cocktails at the counter seats. It also turned out the name of the restaurant is a humorous take on English speakers who butcher the pronunciation of "foie gras."Highly recommended.

I've had consistently good experiences at Foiegwa. The decor and ambiance are great - it feels kind of like an upscale diner. The drinks are creative and nicely presented (they are connected to Atwater Cocktail Club after all). The real draw for me however is the truffle pasta. I order it every time I come here. The truffle shines without being too overwhelming and the portion size is perfect. I highly recommend it - it's the best truffle pasta I've had in Montreal. This place is often quite busy in the evenings so I would recommend a reservation.

I was recommended this restaurant by a friend from Montreal and the pictures on Yelp really sold us. Reservations can be easily booked on their website.After recommendations from my friend and the waitress, we decided to share the beef tartare to start (the smaller size). My boyfriend had not tried beef tartare before, so we were unsure if he would enjoy this. They also bring some bread to pair with the tartare, and I liked how well composed the tartare was. The larger size comes with a side of fries or salad. However, the small size was probably the perfect size for us, as there's only so much raw beef we can eat.Next, we ordered the truffle pasta and their burger with fries, adding in the foie gras for $9.95. The waitress sold us on the foie gras by saying it was the best pairing ever, with the juices and flavour from the foie gras leaking onto the burger. Unfortunately, once we received the burger, the foie gras was nowhere to be seen. The waitress instead brought one on the side, and we placed it in the burger. Maybe because it was served like this, we didn't find that the foie gras really improved the burger. By itself, it was already super delicious, with a very fresh tasting patty, melty cheese, and delicious gravy/sauce covering it. Not to mention all the fries they provided to soak up the sauce!The truffle pasta was delicious. At first it looks like a small portion, but trust me, it's such a heavy dish, you won't be needing more. The truffle flavour is prominent in every bite, and the creamy parmesan really added to the dish. I'd get both of these dishes again.We finished the meal with their soft serve ice cream topped with buttered peanuts and chocolate sauce. A really simple and refreshing dessert that was the perfect end to the meal.Note that even though reservations were gone on their site, the restaurant was about half full for the entirety of our meal. So you could probably call in for a reservation if spots were all gone online.Service was all right. The waitresses were friendly and reasonably prompt. I just wish that the foie gras was not missed on our order; a dessert or something would have been nice as a gesture. The experience may have been completely different if so.I'd come back to try their brunch. It's a bit on the pricier side for sure.

After a few visits at this corner spot on Notre Dame, I had to update my review as soon as I got home because tonight was by far, my most memorable visit at this location. We had early reservations on a Friday night and from the time we were seated till the waitress presented our bill, the service was beyond excellent! We started with some cocktails; I ordered the Kung Fu Panda which not only came in a kitschy glass but was absolutely delish. We followed with a bottle of red wine which was outstanding, thanks to the recommendation of our lovely hostess. We stared with the burrata and Romano tomato tart which was good but lacked on the savoury side; maybe a little more cheese would have been nice. We then ordered some pasta plates, mostly as they seem to be highly popular; I went with the spaghetti dish with butter and black, served with egg and parm, while my friend had the night's special which consisted of ink fettuccine with garlic shrimp and lobster sauce. We both devoured our plates! The pasta was fresh and prefectures cook, and the combo of flavours were just plain outstanding; definitely a hit! We finished with some salted caramel ice cream and the brownie and coffee mascarpone cream. I can't even explain how good that brownie plate was; the dessert was not too sweet and perfectly moist, while the ice cream was nice and creamy. Based on this last visit, I would definitely return to this spot for the delicious comfort food, the nice vibe and great service!

The 1st time I went there was for brunch with some friends because we were in the area, to my surprise, their black truffle (housemade) pasta with 60°Egg is amazing. I've gone  back 2x just for that dish, still tue same, still amazing. If you like truffle, if you like pasta, give it a try! You just might love it too

Came here for brunch, I've been wanting to try forever! TLDR; yummy food very pricey for small quality.Food: we had the truffle pasta, bacon and eggs and the rosti. They were all tasty dishes, but a bit on the overpriced side for the quality and quantity of food. The truffle pasta was creamy and cheesy, and with just the perfect touch of truffle taste. The dishes were overall small and not quite filling. Ambiance/ decor: it's a cute lil restaurant on the corner of a busy street. The decor is very aesthetic, worthy of an instapost. The mirror, prints and plants look great.Service: not fast and not slow. Overall very decent. I don't think I will be back for brunch for some time, given the choices Mtl has to offer.

Made a reservation for my family and I to celebrate my birthday! It was a Friday night 6:45pm. It was busy but not crowded given that the restaurant is small. Our waitress was amazing! So efficient, attentive and nice. I've been wanting to go to Foiegwa for the longest time but didn't have anyone to go with. It's such a beautiful restaurant! I love the caricatures on the walls and the french-ish look of the furniture. I ordered the famous spaghetti truffle, the beef tartar, and a milkshake for dessert. I also sampled their fries and cheese burger from my sister's plate. The food was indeed amazing. So filling but not filling to the point of being stuffed and uncomfortable, and flavourful yet also not too different from what I'm used to. I really would recommend both dishes, it was just so delicious. The milkshake was also great but quite ordinary. The cheese burger did surprise me since it was in a puddle of sauce so you couldn't eat it with your hands. The patty was good and the cheese melted just right. The sauce also did add a little kick to the whole thing. Their fries are also just ordinary but good. Second part of this review is for the brunch! I went with a friend and it was a Sunday around 2:30pm, I didn't think it'd be too crowded since it's close to closing time. there was a mini line up. We waited maybe 10-15 minutes for a table. Which is perfectly reasonable. We didn't get a great table though. It was the first two people one right in front of the entrance door. I ordered the eggs Benedict with bacon! It comes with mini potatoes on the side (a must for brunch in my opinion), and some jelly type thing in a small cup that I didn't touch (didn't touch the tomatoes either). It was really good. Not as good as their spaghetti and/or tartar though. So maybe I should've gone for sweet. Service was great this time too! She wasn't as friendly (didn't engage with us or anything) but she refilled our glasses often, was quick, and answered any questions we had. Overall, it is a bit pricey and crowded so it's really in your best interest to reserve in advance for supper and to maybe call and gage the wait time before brunch. Only reason it isn't a 5 is because I feel like I've had better experiences elsewhere for food/atmosphere. But I still highly recommend this place, at least once.
Nice bar. Over rated I think for the ratings and comments. The city is full of great places. But when you try to go over the top with each item, that is a little too much for my taste.

The food was very, very good. The service was very, very slow. To start- we had a reservation and thank goodness we did cause this place was very busy! We got seated right away and were starving so we ordered the bone marrow appetizer which was VERY delicious but a small portion - this was hard to share. Mostly cause I wanted to eat it all. hehe. A long time later, we got our other platter of foie gras terrine, apple compote, some kind of jelly, and bread. My first time eating foie gras and I really loved how rich it was. I loved doing different combinations with the compote and the jelly, with and without bread, oooh it was good.Lastly we got the famous truffle spaghetti and this was great too! A lot of flavor packed into a smaller dish, but don't be fooled- this was pretty heavy. The truffle flavor was just enough not to empower the dish which I liked. Usually truffle tends to be very strong and I am usually turned off by that.So the food was great, the ambiance of the restaurant is also very charming and hip. However it took forever to get our food and even LONGER to get the check. We had reservations for 6:30 hoping we could still check out a bakery down the street that closed at 8:00. Nope, we left closer to 9. Still wouldn't hold it against them, but this establishment is not a place you want to be if you're in a rush.
A must!! The 2 hour wait was worth it because we got hungry and ordered everything. Best brunch I've ever had!

The food here is FANTASTIC. The AESTHETIC is BEAUTIFUL, and the service was very good. My friends and dropped in for lunch. I ordered the classic 2 eggs with either bacon or sausage. The dish also came with a delicious homemade apple sauce spread and your choice of white or whole-wheat​ toast. Everything was cooked perfectly. We ordered mimosas as well! The orange juice they used was freshly squeezed!!!I definitely recommend stopping by this spot if you're looking for an instagrammable restaurant with fantastic food! My only complaint is that this restaurant is incredibly small​ and as a result, overcrowded.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with 2 others, at around 12:30pm and only waited about 15 minutes, despite there being around 10 people ahead and maybe 10 more behind us. The line moved every 2 minutes or so, which was encouraging. Montreal folks take their brunch seriously.The service was hectic and it was hard to catch the server's attention, but they got around to taking our orders since we were seated right in front of a utensil tray. If you can get over the fact that the plating makes each dish look like an open-faced sandwich with smaller-than-optics portions, for its ingredients the entrees aren't actually unsatisfying for hangry adults. (And if you're still hungry Atwater market is just across the street anyway.) My course arrived with a poached duck egg with caviar(?) smoked salmon on top of a brick-shaped potato rosti. The salmon portion was quite generous, though I don't think I would have given myself so much aoili. It was an adequately savoury combination, though the amount of runny egg yolk vis-a-vis the available dry ingredients made the mouthfeel of each bite a bit too wet and I wish there were more rosti to counteract the abundance of jelloid egg and cream.My friend had a sweet tooth and ordered a brownie for us to share. I'm not even a chocolate lover but gosh, it was rich, and not overpoweringly sweet. It was bready on the outside, and ganache-like inside. I felt like I was eating flourless chocolate cake, in molten form. With three courses, a coffee and a brownie (and no side orders of foie gras) the bill came to $106. In trying to assuage my spending guilt on that debauched weekend, I decided to forego ordering foie gras ($10 per side) or brunch drinks.

Truthfully, this place confuses me. I've visited twice; the first time I was underwhelmed and the second time, I was blown away.On the first visit, I ordered the Truffle pasta. It was basic and there was nothing memorable about it. I was reluctant to visit the restaurant again, but I was pressed for time and had heard good things about the Cheese Burger. So I returned once again and tried it for myself.Let me tell you, the Burger was fantastic - even the French Fries that came with it were delicious. Be warned though, it is messy. You can't pick it up with your hands, so don't even try. If you're going to order the burger, start brushing up on your fork/knife handling now.I've given 4 stars because the I can't forget how unimpressed I was the first time I visited. However, the second visit far surpassed all expectations. If I'm ever craving a burger, I will definitely return.

Location: Southwest, at the corner of Atwater and Notre-Dame Ouest. The closest subway is Lionel-Groulx and it's a 5-minute walk from there. Street parking is available but metered and hard to get - you can find free parking on side streets but check the zoning.The place: It's pretty small and the tables are close together. The decor is simple and similar to most hipster-like places. The vibe is good and I found the place to be cozy and bright.The goods: I ordered a latte and two eggs with sausage and potatoes. I don't know which roast these guys use but the coffee was awful. I found it a little bitter and there was a smoky taste to it that almost seemed burnt. In terms of food, it was solid and the portion was pretty darn good. I would have liked it to be hotter. One of my friends ordered the French toast and there was nothing left on his plate when everything was said and done. He mentioned it was a bit too sweet but nonetheless, he enjoyed it. Service: Good. We got there around 10ish and we were seated right away. The wait staff was friendly.Price point: My food was 8.50 but I don't recall how much the latte was. Not bad considering the location.

A last minute reservation was placed for Foiegwa after hearing some great local recommendations. This appears to be a newer trendy spot that both locals, and tourists can like, but reservations really are needed, even on weekdays. The restaurant itself is charming in a diner meets hipster sort of way. It's clean, kitschy without being too cluttery. 1970's rock hits were played over the speakers. The clientele ranged from younger 9-5er's enjoying after work conversations and cocktails to older locals known by name. I ordered a cocktail, which I unfortunately cannot remember, but it was good AND strong. I ordered the cheeseburger topped with Foie-gras, because when in Rome, right? I received a cheeseburger topped with a couple pieces of Foie-gras, sitting in a pool or caramelized deliciousness, surrounded by a heaping mound of fries. A fork & knife type of affair, for sure! I was no match for the fries -- I tapped out long before 1/2 was devoured. The burger was good, the foie-gras was great (and btw, can be added to any dish you order).No room was left for dessert, and I was truly disappointed in myself, because it all sounded really delectable. The service was really great here. It was attentive and warming! I enjoyed my experience and would gladly come back here!Pricing is moderate, so save your sheckles!

Cute little resto that's always packed. Luckily there's a farmers market across from it to help kill time. Make sure you go early enough for brunch to avoid the long wait time and to make reso for dinner if you can! I didn't have the chance to stay for dinner but brunch was delicious!We shared the butter truffle pasta and man oh man was it ever rich for early morning but it was so delicious! Had to try it out after so many people raved about it. We ordered the brioche French toast that was smothered in sauce and Chantilly cream. The toast was soft and not very crispy. It was good but not my fav. Regardless, it was very filling for the two of us!Our waitress was very nice and helpful.

You know when a place is overhyped and then it ends up disappointing? Well, that certainly is not the case for Foiegwa. I still remember when this place used to be a La Belle Pro and I was doubtful that they could fit a brunch spot here. The decor is absolutely beautiful, kind of like your standard diner but elevated with some whimsical and eclectic touches like the gold frosted mirrors and bw illustrations. The food is outstanding. Everything from the œuf bénédictine to the chicken and waffles was exceptional. It's always a good sign when a place's menu is relatively small so you know they're doing the few they have exceptionally well. I had the fresh fruits with sabayon, perfect blend between a fresh and a light sweet flavour. I can't say I'm not in love. If you're going on the weekend, either get there early or expect to wait at least 15 minutes. It's well worth the wait and you can't go wrong choosing Foiegwa.

We were going to Le Vin Papillon with a party of 5 thinking we'd get a table.... Ha! So we made a wise decision to run over to Foiegwa instead. I was the only one in the group who's never been here before and everyone found it quite amusing.The place is decorated like a dinner, old-school feel for sure. Everything makes u think that u'd get nana's food and strawberry pie once seated. But nope, the menu surprised me. Frog legs, snails, truffle pasta, etc. I got the Kungfu Panda drink with gin & pandan, it was yummy. We had truffle pasta, scallop risotto, frog legs, market veggies, duck magret and the sole. Everything was delicious. The staff was friendly, funny and very helpful. I had a great time. We even head over to their bar Atwater Cocktail for a drink. I would definitely come back :)

I have been to Foiegwa for dinner! Which was an amazing experience. My two best friends are from out of town, and they were visiting for Easter weekend. I haven't seen them for three years. They asked me to find a place near a metro; so the first restaurant that popped in my head for brunch was Foiegwa near Lionel Groulx. The restaurant was booked so the hostess put me on the guest list. She said I will get a text when a table would be free. We went for a walk in Atwater Market, and started to catch up. We got a text within 1/2hr. Got seated, and my friends ordered croque Madame and I ordered eggs Benedict with spinach and goat cheese, and everyone with a cup of coffee. Everything was super delicious! We Enjoyed every single bite of our dishes! Service was super quick! After we finished our meal, right way we got our bills, and they asked us to free the table now...it was little disappointing because we didn't even finish our coffee... at the same time it's understandable since the lineup from outside was huge. We ended up later at my favorite bakery.

Meal was absolutely delicious! I had the famous black truffle spaghetti and it was beyond appetizing! I don't care for runny eggs but ordered it anyway and gave the egg to my friend... so glad that I did... such a good brunch meal! For the restaurant itself it is very tight and popular so crowded on a Sunday for sure... at first we were seated in a very tight, high chair  area but when a table opened up our waiter was nice enough to let us know and gave us the option to move so we did. My friends also thoroughly enjoyed their chicken and waffles.

Got ripped off tonight! Terrible experience (cheap food cheap server and cheap service)Spent 225 for two adults, didn't feel we eat anything at all. DON'T EVER GO THIS TERRIBLE PLACE. YOU CAN'T AFFORD IT!

You come here for the foreplay but you stay for the afterglow. The seductively al dente black truffle spaghetti is crowned with a generous and heaping mound of Parmigiano reggiano which serves as a cosy nest for the perfectly cooked 64° egg yolk. The sex starts when you use your fork and spoon to gently toss everything together. You see that dark trufffffle rub up against that creamy spaghetti; everything glistens in the moonlight and glides ever so slowly together with the sensual help of the unctuous aromatic extra virgin olive oil. How about some of the best French fries this city has on offer, smothered in béchamel and black truffle with a generous heaping of Parmigiano reggiano. How about that? This place has everything you need to get into heaven. Enjoy.

****4.5 out of 5 stars****Foiegwa is an upscale diner located in the Atwater Market, accessible from the Lionel-Groulx metro station also.  The diner is quite small and cozy, so therefore reservations are a must, walk-ins are a miracle!  We saw a few parties walked away as they didn't reserve.  Food was close to perfection!Appetizer:French Onion Soup (very flavourful, lots of cheese)Chicken Liver Pate (a must with bread!)Mains:Cheeseburger and fries (the best I ever had)Truffle Spaghetti (good but portion was very small)Foiegwa casserole with duck & sausage (average)Desserts:Vanilla Creme brûlée (good crust, more vanilla would have been better!)Goat cheese and lime cheesecake (A++, first time having it in goat cheese, very strong flavour, will pair very well with dessert wine)Milk Shake Paris-Brest (praline flavour, absolutely divine)Overall, I really enjoy this place.  They serve brunch as well, will try that next time.  FYI:  no reservation available during brunch, prepare for the wait!

Came here during my trip to Montreal and have received a lot of recommendations to go to this place. I can see why now. We ordered the truffle pasta and the seafood risotto. I would give the risotto a 4/5 - it was a bit on the saltier side for me.  However, the home run was the truffle pasta -  that made me speechless. It was absolutely amazinggggg and you had to break the egg yolk on top which then trickle down and glazed over the pasta balancing out the truffle and Parmesan cheese. This has to be by far one of the best meals I've had on my trip. We also ordered the brownie, which was a disappointment. Too much cocoa, not enough sweetness, and not as dense as I would like it to be. If you're looking for an actual typical browner, I would avoid ordering the brownie.I gave this a 5 star because the truffle pasta just took it home!! Definitely a must try.

Despite all the rave reviews it took me quite a while to finally try out Foiegwa simply because I am not in St-Henri very often.  The vibe is old school diner meet French food.  At brunch they offer a sizeable menu with all kinds of delicious-looking dishes to satiate your appetite.  They also serve dinner.   For fear that if we showed up too late the line-up would be long our group of four arrived at 9:30 and were seated right away.  By the time we left though there were people queuing for a table.  If you're someone who doesn't really like waiting for food I would suggest that you get there as early as possible.Now I can finally talk about the food, which was so delicious.  I ordered what they called a rosti, which is akin to a latke, so a potato pancake in other words.  This was garnished with a generous serving of smoked salmon, creme fraiche and capers.  There was also a bit of caviar served on the side.  I really enjoyed it and found that the flavours complemented each other nicely.  For a price of $18 I felt that I got what I paid for.My only minor complaint was regarding the service.  They must have been backed up in the kitchen because we had to wait a bit for our food.  However, the waitress came by often to top up our coffee mugs and we had no trouble getting water refills.After yearning to try it for so long I am so glad to have finally eaten at Foiegwa.  The restaurant merits the large number of positive reviews.  I'll definitely be adding it to my list of preferred brunch places in Montreal.
Everyone raves about the truffle pasta and now I see why. It showed up every other plate of pasta I've had thus far. The cocktails are great too! Sit at the bar if you can.

To be fair I will say they deserve 3.5 stars, because the wine we had was definitely above average. Kudos to their wine buyer. Aside from that the service was quite underwhelming. The staff was definitely having their own fun though. The food was decent, but not great. The bone marrow was good and the foie gras too, but the portions were weirdly designed. Their "home made" pasta dish was either mistakenly described or just really looked and tasted like dry pasta. Either way, not a success. In summary, I wouldn't recommend.

I came here on a Wednesday night with friends for the 1st time for all 4 of us. Surprisingly it was pack considering it was a week night.The food was good but very heavy and greasy. The cheeseburger was ok but very greasy and overpriced for what it was. It was a good thing that we didn't order the foie gras on the side given that it was already very oily. The soggy fries that came with the burger was actually good but again very greasy. The fried chicken was juicy, the truffle spaghetti was good but very heavy. They put way too much cheese on top of the spaghetti.....it literally covered all the pasta.I think it's a place you would go once just to try, and not go back again given the food is very heavy and greasy.

We came here for brunch with friends. It was a great service and tasty food, I like the portions of the food not huge plates but small and artistic portions. The server was feeling my coffee like every 5 minutes which I find very useful especially on brunch(some places you have to flag them down for refills) The 4 starts out of 5 was for the host/server who wouldn't sit us because our friend was parking. They won't sit you until you're whole party is at the door or that's what they told us ‍ I would definitely come back!!!

Place had good reviews, so decided to check it out. Ultimately, was Disappointing and Overpriced. I ordered the truffle spaghetti, burger, and fried chicken. Spaghetti truffle: 2/10 was disappointing and did not taste good. The egg yolk also did not mesh wellBurger: 5/10 - decent but nothing special.Chicken: 3.5/10 - was not what I expected and was more along the line chicken tenders with bones. Service is fine and location is good, but the establishment thinks they are more high-end than they actually are. The prices are severely overpriced, would recommend the McDonalds across the street - better food, for half the price.

Hubby and i got up early on a long weekend Sunday morning just to avoid waiting in line here. We had experienced and loved the kitchen front row seats at Au Pied Du Cochon so when i found out one of their chefs was behind Foiegwa we were in. Grabbed 2 seats at the bar to witness the kitchen and the bartender in their natural habitat. Love watching the drinks/shots flowing at 10am. Fresh juices and coffee smells filled the air with a view of amazing selection of liquors and whiskey lining the wall. We ordered the baked ratatouille with goal cheese in a flakey buttery pastry and the spinach goat cheese benedict. The best and most buttery hollandaise sauce ive ever had. My ratatouille had the standard peppers, zucchini, eggplant and tomates lined with fresh goat cheese and a delicious smokey roasted eggplant sauce. All wrapped around each other and baked into a delicious crust. Served with a fresh side salad!Fresh OJ and coffee complimented the meal perfectly. We were soooo full and delightfully satisfied from this perfect brunch.

Wow, Foiegwa. You have won over my heart!! I was just in Montreal for the first time this past weekend and wanted to try some good French cuisine. This restaurant was highly recommended by tons of people while I was researching where to eat. I came here right when they opened on a Saturday evening and my friend and I were seated immediately. I forgot our waiter's name, but he was VERY sweet throughout the night. My friend wanted a moscato d'asti, a sweet dessert wine, but they did not have it unfortunately. Our waiter kindly brought our about three different wines for her to taste, but they were all too strong of a taste for her. I was too reluctant to try the cocktails because I wasn't so sure on the liquors, but I hope to try them next time I'm back! We both ended up ordering a mimosa for the night, simple and easy. The mimosa was made of freshly squeezed orange and a nice champagne. Really refreshing, compared to most places I've been to, where they use juice from concentrate. We decided to order three things to share for the night and didn't want to over order since we weren't going to be taking leftovers home. We got the escargots, the truffle spaghetti, and the beef tartare, with two foie gras on the side. I was a little iffy about getting the foie gras, because I've had it once and vowed to never have it again because of the after taste. But my friend said to get it somewhere that specifically knows how to cook French or get it in a French populated area, such as Canada. Our food arrived fairly quick and was probably one of the best dinners I've had this year. To start off, the escargots were nice in texture, not overcooked, and lightly covered with butter. Very tasty and not overpowering. The beef tartare was a bit on the chillier side, but had a nice kick to it. The beef was tender and soft, but there were some nice strips of fried noodles that added a bite texture to it. It was my first time having beef tartare as well and I must say, not bad! I wasn't expecting beef tartare to be served raw, or to be raw in general, but it lived up to my liking since I do like my steak to be more on the rare side. The foie gras, WOW. I was not expecting the foie gras to be so delicious and tasty. It was truly and honestly WAY better than the one I've had before and this time, I could actually swallow and stomach it down. Foie gras is just a product that is fattened, so maybe that's why I enjoyed it because it reminds me that I'm eating that. Last but not least was the best dish out of the bunch; the truffle spaghetti. It was plated beautifully and topped with freshly grated parmesan cheese. The truffle was not overpowering and the sauce was evenly coating the pasta. The spaghetti was cooked al dente, so it had a nice bite to it. Everything was amazing from the staff, to the ambiance, and most importantly, the food. I can't wait to be back in Montreal and I can't wait to bring friends to experience this wonderful place!

Came for a boozy brunch here my birthday morning after it was recommended to me by several friends. We were happy we made it!We arrived around 10:30 am on a Saturday and expected a huge line. There were several people waiting at the door but we walked right up to the hostess and she said there were seats at the bar available which nobody seemed to want so we were seated immediately.The bar is fun because you get to see some amazing drinks being made. One table ordered a round of shots that were half vanilla liqueur and half espresso which looked like a great way to start the day!I ordered a cereal killer cocktail and had the smoked salmon dish while my wife opted for a mimosa and some grilled cheese with soft boiled egg. My dish was clearly the star and I really enjoyed it!The cocktails were also great and added a fun play on breakfast. Would love to try everything here but our stomachs are only so big.One great thing is the Atwater Market is across the street so you can walk around there after breakfast to burn off the calories.

Food: Went for a late brunch got the salmon toast with caviar on top and the truffle pasta, chicken waffles. All three were amazing would definitely come back.  Cons: the wait! If you are not patient and dont like to wait for more than 20 min ai dont suggest you go there. We came for 1 pm and got seated at 2:45 pm. They dont take reservations unfortunately. They take your number and text you when your table is ready.

If you're in Montreal, this resto is absolutely a must-try! While it may not be the cheapest place to eat or have the biggest portions, this place is worth the splurge. I've heard about this place many times, and I'm so happy that I tried it out because the food did not disappoint.Me and my friends decided to start off with their fries with bechamel sauce and their bone marrow snack. The fries came in a very generous portion (great for sharing) with a creamy bechamel sauce topped with scallions, while the bone marrow came with a thin slice of bread and sauce which was small but rich in flavour and melted in your mouth. To drink, we loved the Bella Vita and Scarlet cocktails, which were tasty and refreshing. Next, we ordered their famous spaghetti with black truffle, the cheeseburger with foie gras and the fried chicken with waffle fries. While their fried chicken was pretty good, it wasn't anything amazing. However, their spaghetti and burger lived up to the hype - being rich in flavour and aroma, overall delicious. Overall, I definitely recommend this place for lunch/supper and especially for dates (beautiful decor). Great food for reasonable prices, pleasant staff and great service. Also, because this place is usually packed, I recommend making reservations!

Had a fun early dinner here with a friend before a show at the Corona.  It's a cute little spot with a funky bar and friendly service.  We were initially seated at the bar but there was a cancellation for a table so we were able to snag a better spot.  We shared an order of espelette peppers to start, served with bread and prosciutto.  They were a little too spicy for me, so I gave up and ate the bread and prosciutto which was quite good.  I had the cod  a la Bourguignonne, which was quite good, and my friend had the fish and chips, the special of the evening, which she said was very good.  All washed down with a decent bottle of burgundy and we were good to go...

We were having Father's Day brunch at Foiegwa. The restaurant was small and crowded but waitresses came to serve us immediately which is a plus.We had Benedictine eggs with smoked salmon and a smoothie of the day.Everything was delicious and the restaurant itself is well-located just next to Atwater market.
The duck confit omelette with the foie was amazing. The space is a bit small but the food is so delicious you'll be in and out in no time

Went to this place twice. The first time was for a dinner and we were a group of 3. All of their tables were reserved for 1 hour later so they asked us if it would be ok to get the table for only 1h. We did and as we waited for the food to arrive, the waiter said he made a mistake and the reservation was actually for right now. He squeezed us in a small table for 2 and we have to be very careful not to make the plates fall of our table since we ordered too much food. However, they wanted to make up for their mistake and inconvenience and offered us free desserts on the house. Now that's what I call attentive service. As the for the food, it's awesome. No other words needed. The black truffle spaghetti is so flavorful. It's prob my fave dish so far. The other dishes such as the bone marrow, escargot, salmon rillettes were also pretty good. The second time we went was for brunch. The benedict egg with salmon was pretty decent, but the sauce was a bit too sweet. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Make sure you reserve before!

Had the pasta and it was to die for!! Most the options in the menu didn't really interest me so check the menu first before going but I'm sure if you find dishes you're interested in, they'll be really good. The atmosphere was nice too
Loved the food, cutesy vintage look, and drinks. Staff was friendly, food came quickly. Loved all my foie gras dishes. Even bought a t-shirt from them'n

I came here on a Tuesday night. I've been to Atwater Cocktail Club, the speakeasy attached to Foiegwa, many times now and loved my experience each and every time. I knew their cocktail game was strong so was excited to finally try their food. I left greasy and bloated, but beaming.I had heard so many good things about their truffle spaghetti that it would have been wrong not to order it. In addition to the pasta we had the bone marrow, chicken liver pate, market veggies, cheeseburger and in yolo let's have a heart attack fashion we added extra foie gras in the burger.It was the perfect love child of French bistro meets greasy diner. The truffle spaghetti was salty, chewy, and everything you'd want to eat on a cheat day. The cheeseburger came with perfectly crispy fries- they also serve these next door at $3 a plate and are a must-have for late night munchies. The patty sandwiched between pillowy brioche buns was juicy and simply lovely (again, in an oily messy way). The foiegwa was nicely seared but was not particularly memorable. The music deserves a special mention as well- this place is awesome!

Take me to a place that will flood my mind with old school days and bring a whirlwind of flavours to my palate...Foiegwa.The location and decor for this venue were perfect- cozy, alluring with the right amount of seating that does not overcrowd you with noise. The menu was simple with an array of options for the non veg or veg. I tried a creamy, smooth chicken liver paté as an opener snack.  Followed by the Beef Tartare for a starter; truffle spaghetti, clams/mussels, ratatouille- all were light and shareable main dishes; ended with an apple crumble for dessert and a mind tripping orange soda Float  that took me back to school days. I loved everything about this place- in my books next to Cadet. compliments to Gabrielle for the suggestions and Chefs Jeremie Falissard, Roberto Barroco & co. for your enchanting culinary skills.

Sht is fire bro. Pancakes was Odee on point, maaad whip cream. Get the OJ sht was lit. But anyway, I also tried to truffle spaghetti. One word, "Boy". Liquor store is right around the corner too. Yaaaaasss.

Went here for brunch on a saturday morning! There is always a line but it's worth it ! The prices are okay but for those prices I just expected a little more food on the plates.The food is like a basic breakfast menu but all with a twist. Each dish is really flavorful, wished i tried their infamous pancakes  The decor is soo nice i even got out a good instapic of it. Definitely a place to hit up with ur gal friends !

A friend recommended this place and I was attracted by the beautiful interior design. To start, I had the bone marrow appetizer followed by the truffle spaghetti. When I usually get bone marrow, they're split length-wise so that it's easier to eat out of, and thought that the portion was a bit on the smaller side. It was super tasty otherwise.The spaghetti was delicious! The truffle was very aromatic and it was topped with a generous amount of shaved parm cheese (I think). This was for dinner, but I can't wait to try their famous brunch menu :)

Those who may (or may not) know me very well do know that I love food. Not just any food, great f-ing food. I'm gonna go on the record and say that I just had THE BEST meal I've ever had in my life! Like, "WTF, WHERE HAS THIS BEEN WHOLE LIFE" type of good. So good that I question how good it really is. My drink was both beautiful and delicious. Our starters were pretty amazing. We had escargot and bone marrow. Both just melt in your mouth. The kind of good where your eyes roll to the back of your head.Then the entrees came. My husband and my cousin ordered the same thing, cheeseburger with foie gras. At first we thought that was truely the best thing. The burger had to be eaten with a knife and fork because it was so juicy. The foie gras just added another dimension to it. YUM!Then my other cousin's Arctic char came out. It was almond crusted with a giant heap of caviar added to the top of it. Oh boy, we were certain that was the best dish.Then my spaghetti came out. OMFG, what was I eating?? This thing was covered in parmigiano reggiano, black truffle and butter. Then topped with a runny egg. I was worried that I didn't have enough food. Once you take that 1st bite, all is forgotten. It was so rich and decadent!All in all, this place is unbelievable!! Cannot wait to go back!!

Was in the Atwater Marche area and couldn't help but be drawn into this restaurant. Love how it has an old school vibe with a modern twist. I couldn't stop looking around and staring at all the details from the marble community table top to the caricatures of famous, historic Québécois.  I asked one of the servers if anyone pictured has ever come in. She hesitated and smiled, "Nah, they're all pretty much dead."  We shared a good laugh. Although you can order a side of foiegwa with everything I thought it might be too rich with the truffle spaghetti everyone has been howling about. I sat at the bar and saw all the food coming out and the spaghetti was definitely the most popular. Unfortunately, I was not impressed and actually a little disappointed that I spent so much on lunch. That's my fault for not ordering anything with foiegwa. I mean, you are at a restaurant that bares its name.  The mimosa was INCREDIBLE though.  Had to resist all temptation for ordering second one. I will have to come back and try the cheeseburger with foiegwa.

Amazing French restaurant. Perfect ratatouille. Jus like how the dish is know. It's really amazing!!!! Also the mimosa. It was quiet busy but was able to get seats using Yelp. Pretty waitresses though

What a fun, French-cafe inspired diner opened as late as surrounding clubs and pubs, read: perfect for post drinking food. If you're having too much fun in the Little Burgundy area, don't be intimidated by the fancy sounding name of Foiegwa. Much more expensive than McDonald's obviously, with appetizers at around $14, but much classier and impressive, especially if you're with a date. You can order anything from giant ginger ale floats to marrow here. And all night long they played 80-90s hits. Forget the pubs--better times to be had here.

How can begin? How can end? Should ending come? I hope never with this small heaven.All service was special and full of cleverness. Menu was walk in colourful garden, each flower enticing you to smell and fancy. Many items featuring strange meats, unknown to mass capitalist processing system. Liver, bones, tartar. Can you flavour these?Yes, I dared these adventures.First, bone. Unique and delicate. Then tartar with egg and duck liver. Full expectation realized, then furthered. Following, filet mignon,  cooked with specification. Ending gave final drop of sweetness.Senior wine expert made consultation. Additional impressions acheived.Always, feelings of home and welcome.Life is lived here.

They have quality ingredients but the food is bland and poorly prepared. Had the Perigourdine omelet which was tasteless; Ricotta and Blueberry pancakes which were blah and slightly underdone; and Black Truffle and butter spaghetti in which the pasta is supposedly made fresh in-house but it was hard and undercooked so it was inedible.

Great vibe; great decor; even better food.  Foiegwa is an all around home run.  Atmosphere wise, I was a big fan of the diner feel and the drawings of famous patrons on the wall.  It made me feel like I was in a small cafe/diner in Paris.  Food wise, I had the decadent organic fried chicken, which was extremely large and very flavorful.  The real draw though was my girlfriend's dish, which was the homemade spaghetti with butter and black truffle, topped with an egg yolk.  This was an extremely rich dish with such a deep buttery and truffle flavor that I honestly had never experienced before.  My girlfriend enjoyed it so much that she claimed she legitimately dreamed about it that night.  Additionally, they have a great cocktail menu and to fit right in with the diner feel, they have a strong dessert menu too.  So if you are just in town visiting or are a resident of the city, I highly recommend making it over to Foiegwa as soon as possible.

Over a three day weekend, we came here twice.  Food is top notch, bartender (Simon) is incredible, and the playlist after 9pm (leans soul/r&b/hip-hop) was exceptional.  Seating is limited but available if you're patient.  Seriously stop the debating and hand-wringing over where to dine over the weekend and just go to Foiegwa.  I will always stop here whenever I'm in Montreal. Period.

Must try in Montreal! You have to get reservations, otherwise don't bother going. Everything was good here and it was a nice and cozy atmosphere. For appetizer we tried the bone marrow (small portion but full in flavour), steak tar tar (absolute must), garlic escargot (few pieces only - can pass). For mains we tried the scallop risotto (packed with so much flavour super delicious!), truffle pasta (must try!) and lastly the foie Gras burger(have to add foie  gras -extra $9 I believe). Personally I'm not a big fan of foie gras but my friends that had it though it  was good. Would definitely come back again. Goor pricing for what you get. Also forgot to mention, I tried the kung fu panda drink which I though was unique. The drink came in a panda cup !
The best ricotta pancakes and croque madame I have ever tasted ! Wait for Sunday brunch was quite a while, but all worth it!

One of the most delicious restaurants I've ever been to. Patrick (our waiter) was so eloquent when describing the style of food & the mission of the restaurant. His passion was bursting out of him! The ambiance was superb. Thank you! We will definitely return on our next Montreal trip!
Food taste good but service is so bad. The waiters rushed us to leave even if we were still eating. Found it very inappropriate.Always expect a big line up on weekends.

My boyfriend, brother, and I came here for a late brunch on Saturday. It was safe to say it was delicious. In spite, we were placed in an extremely squishy corner and the table was way too small for three people. It barley fit all the food we ordered. Keeping in mind, the restaurant itself isn't very large. The brunch menu is only served on Friday (10-3pm), Saturday & Sunday (9:30am-3:30pm). We ordered the Confit Duck Omelette $17, Rosti $17.75, and least but not last, grilled cheese slices dipped in 2 soft boiled eggs $12.95. Firstly, my boyfriend's Confit Duck Omelette meal which was filling but he would have preferred it more if there was more confit duck. I recommend La Avenue Restaurant for their Confit Duck Benedict. Meanwhile, my borther Rosti meal was delicious, but not as filling. The house cream was to die for. My brother was still a bit hungry after his meal and decided to have some of grilled cheese and potatoes. Overall the grilled cheese was good but I think I would have preferred it if they used poached eggs instead of soft boiled egg.

Just an all around amazing experience! Service - excellent! The atmosphere - just perfect! The food? The food! It took my partner, the biggest food critique i know, a single bite to proclaim their chicken & waffles to be the best he's ever had. So yeh, Foiegwa gets a very big 5 stars from us!

Black. Truffle. Spaghetti. Add the foie gras, or don't - this dish can hold its own. Im a fan of this dish solo. I honestly don't know what else they serve here and, honestly, don't mind too much if this pasta was all they served, it's THAT good.

Foiegwa, you almost killed me with your spiked "non-alcoholic" London Virgin but I forgive you because a week later I'm still obsessing over your Truffle Spaghetti Maison like a steamy one night stand. Methinks our Bocata friends (who recommended Foiegwa) phoned ahead to make sure we had a "spirited" evening .Foiegwa is a tight little corner hot spot that packs in patrons nightly so definitely make a reservation. The menu offerings are all the things they do well so any choice is a winner. But let me again emphasize how good the Truffle Spaghetti is! When every table has at least one order of this dish, your FOMO will be tears of regret if you don't get this dish. My dear daughter ordered the pasta bolognese and she loved it but if she could have devoured my dish after sampling a bite of my Truffle Spaghetti, she would. She is now back at college crying in her dorm thinking of the missed strands of spaghetti coated in buttery black truffle sauce, mixed with a newly broken egg yolk under a Mont Royal heap of freshly grated parmigiano reggiano cheese. Don't let this happen to you. It's over 2200 miles (over 3200 km) for us to get back to this Montreal hot spot. Get this dish if you ever have the opportunity to go.Bon appetite!

We came here on a whim last Saturday for date night on our quest to try as many new places in Montreal in 2017 and it was a great last minute decision!We arrived around 9pm without a reservation and were quickly seated at a communal table as everything else was fully booked. Having read amazing reviews across the board we ordered the beef tartare and truffled green beans to start and the truffled spaghetti and beef bourguignon as the mains. To our (pleasant) surprise, the hostess remembered that we preferred to have our own table, and came to let us know that a cancellation had just come through which we really appreciated. After we moved to another table, the food started to come out. The appetizers were absolutely delicious, and the mains that shortly followed were equally yummy. Everything was PERFECT. Although it took quite some time for all the food to come out, you could tell that everything was made with love (as cheesy as that sounds) using great ingredients.The only one small negative was that my cocktail (Scarlett something) wasn't really very good but this isn't a big enough negative to knock any stars off. 5 stars for excellent food!

The food was awesome  Opted for their pasta selection and it was delicious. I'd recommend reserving a table. My group and I tried to go there for breakfast and the place was packed! We ended up going their for dinner but made reservations this time. Worth it!

Lined up outside for 45min, but 10000% worth the wait! The tables were close to each other, but the cozy atmosphere + vibe made up for it. As for the food, the pancakes were super fluffy, and melted in our mouths. The salmon eggs benedict was the perfect amount of food. Next time we visit Montreal, we are definitely coming back to Foiegwa (both for brunch and dinner). Looking forward to it!

We walked in around noon on a Sunday and luckily got a table right away. The woman who sat us told us that we had to sit either at the bar or the high table. When I asked if we could sit at a regular table, she said we couldn't. No reason given. There were plenty of clean tables and nobody was waiting; they don't take reservations. Whatever. We sat and ordered our food (and the Paris Brest milkshake. Soooooooo good). I ended up getting the eggs Benedict with ham and my girlfriend got the ham and cheese omelette. My eggs benny were amazing. The yolk was perfectly runny, the Hollandaise was nice and rich, and they served it alongside these amazing potatoes, a roasted tomato, and really good applesauce(?). My girlfriend's omelette was a bit too underdone and lacked flavor. It is pricy, especially for how much you get. But overall it is pretty good.

I've come here twice already but the thing about their food is that, too much can be overwhelming. I've tried their chicken and waffle and the maple syrup overwrites all the other flavours. The egg Benedict is actually nice, I have tried the salmon Benedict and I would recommend that for breakfast. I tried the pancake too and loved it but I shared it with friends so I only had to have one pancake. I am not sure if I would love it the same if I had to eat all four pancakes. It's very greasy and unnervingly sweet. The staff is very friendly. Great ambience and super cute decor. A very Instagram friendly place. It's diner themed. The portions are HUGE !

I finally got to try foiegwa! I really enjoyed it. The decor is nice, the ambiance is pleasant, and more importantly the food is delicious.I kept hearing about the burger with the extra foie gras, so obviously I had to try it. It is indeed awesome. It's not the best burger I've had in my life however, which is what I was hoping for. At 27-28$, I fully expected to have my mind blown. What I got was a really good - no; an excellent burger with great meat, a good bun, and a hint of a taste of foie gras. The taste of the cheese was completely lost, and so is taste of foie gras.I think there's a better burger to be made with these quality ingredients. Maybe a different, tastier cheese, and perhaps a different cooking method for the foie gras so the taste is more pronounced. I think there were caramelized onions? I'm not sure. Maybe even a completely different burger with the same ingredients but without the sauce, and with salad, tomato, raw onions and cold foie gras. That could be exiting, I don't know. Oh and one more thing - my friend had the spaghetti. It looks awesome, and he described it as really good. He was a little disappointed by the size of the portion however. I get that truffle sauce is expensive, but pastas are not. It's not a valid reason to put 15 spaghettis on a plate and call it a main course.Nevertheless, I still recommend that you try this place at least once. I look forward to trying the spaghetti on a future visit actually.Yeah. It's good. Pricey though. The kinda place where beautiful yuppies go to be seen, and they overpay a little for that privilege.It's nice that their kitchen is open late, very convenient.I wish these was a bigger and better beer selection. The place looked like it would feel a bit crammed, but it's not that bad. We had a table by the window, it worked out for us 3 big men. Maybe if you have a small table for 2 in the middle by the bathroom it would probably feel a little bit more crammed. Anyway. The food is good. You should go.
One word: amazing. Their black truffle pasta is on point; the blood orange cocktail was perfect and that brownie dessert with mascarpone cream and coffee dusting was phenomenal. Will be going back.

We had just gotten in to Montreal and decided we wanted a late night bite. Foiegwa was still open and we headed over. We started with frogs legs. The ranch dill sauce was good though the legs themselves were just okay. The gazpacho was nice, especially the delicious brioche covered in crab meat that came with it. The vegetables with bagna cuda were great. We shared a fried chicken sandwich which came with honey they sourced from their roof top. It was tender juicy chicken that was barely breaded and went perfectly with the honey. The spot definitely has a cute diner theme. The staff was very friendly. Reasonably priced. I'd recommend for late night dining or any time.
Great food and service. Omelette was perfectly prepared. The potatoes were a touch greasy for my taste. But overall excellent

I've been here so many times and I have to admit, overall Foiegwa is a great place for drinks, food and late nights. It is located right outside Lionel metro, it's opened till 2 am, there's very a large variety of drinks and their beef tartare is absolutely the main reason why I come to Foiegwa. I love the vibe that they have going on, cozy with a chic finish to it. I highly recommend and youll probably see me having drinks by the bar
Tasty  food!!! Strongly recommend the pancake!!!!For the duck confit, it is around average loll

Brunch Review!This place is a gorgeous brunch location and convenient place to meet your friends. I love the environment and they have a lot of seating for such a small space. I had the blueberry pancakes which were amazingly soft and my friend had their version of the croque madame which is a form of ham and cheese sandwich with egg. The portion sizes were fair and the service was friendly. I loved eating in the bright sunlight and enjoying a bit of the Atwater environment on my way to brunch! The cuisine is pretty standard for brunch and leans french. I would come back to try some of the other non-brunch food in the nice space. Come for the pics and stay for more food!

I loved the feel of this restaurant, relaxed and unassuming - and yet the food was absolutely on point! We didn't have reservations which meant we sat at the bar, and I actually enjoyed that vantage point because we got to see into the kitchen a bit. We shared the Bone Marrow "snack" to start, which was just large enough for us to have a few bites each. There was a bit of grated truffle on top and a velvety Bordelaise sauce which was divine. I was in the mood for a lighter main course, so I selected the Warm Ratatouille and Goat Cheese Tart. There was a selection of vegetables on a puff-pastry base, and there was a hint of balsamic vinegar if I'm not mistaken. The size was big enough as it was, but it also came with a green salad simply dressed with a vinaigrette. I enjoyed the freshness and simplicity of the dish. I also tried a bite of the Fried Chicken with Gribiche sauce, which was at once moist, crispy, and creamy from the sauce; a luscious mouthful. I can't wait to return and taste more of the menu (and check out the bar next door).

It's a nice little restaurant, makes for instagram worthy pictures. I had their eggs Benedict with spinach and cream cheese. It was too salty for me, i should've ordered something else. Everything else except the eggs was good. They had really good pancakes. I also liked the service, very friendly.

Good food, good drink, service was solid. The truffle spaghetti is unreal, highly recommend. Recommend getting a reservation as we had to wait a bit and there's really no area to comfortably stand and they weirdly wouldn't let us hang by the bar while we waited.

Incredible brunch. Had the tartine du pain - came with eggplant, ricotta, poached eggs, and an olive oil and green salad. Absolutely delicious and great service - kind servers who were attentive and polite. Also very fast!!

Best brunch omg. The service was good and im still in awe regarding the pancakes. And their orange juice is so fresh. Im not giving 5 stars because the place is not so big and the waiting time can be a little bit long (specially on sundays). Other than that I HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Atmosphere is laid back with a hint of fancy. It's set up to look like a dinner but the lights are slightly dimmed to cater to dressy attire as well. I noticed the theme applies to the food also, they serve some simplistic food but with an "oomph". We ordered tartare, snails, the cheese burger and spaghetti.Tartare- very good, if you like raw meat you can't go wrong.Snail- never tried them before and for a first experience I would say they were seasoned appropriate for their texture and made them quite enjoyable.Burger- we got it with extra foies gras. It's like a glorified cheese burger ... It had to be the most satisfying cheese burger I ever tasted. The foie gras adds to its fatty and greasy texture. Overall my favourite dish.Spaghetti- loved the buttery/creamy texture. The egg added to its delicious multitude of flavours.

Recently visited Montreal and came across this gem. It's small and intimate and decorating beautifully . We were seated right away . I enjoyed the chicken and waffles immensely and the cola float was lovely as well. The service was exceptional . Annie was my waitress and she made sure to make me feel welcomed and made sure I had everything I needed to endure a great visit.
Wonderful place. Great food and service. The food is a little bit pricey but it's worth visiting.

I decided to check this place out after reading the Yelp reviews on it, although I'm not sure I understand what the big deal is. My boyfriend and I came to eat here after showing up at Vin Papillon and realizing they were on holiday as it was just down the street.  We were seated immediately but it took nearly 20 minutes to order drinks, which took even longer to arrive, and 30 to order our meal and that didn't arrive in a decent amount of time, either. The menu is overpriced and the dishes are tiny.  Don't get me wrong -- I don't mind an expensive (read: fabulous) meal here or there (Toque! is fantastic and Parc restaurant might have the best raw fish I'll ever have) but for the lack of complexity in Foiegwa's dishes, the presentation, service, and portion sizes the $120 after a modest tip for a starter, one scant for two plate and two glasses of wine their pricing seemed absolutely absurd.  The Daumen Cote du Rhone was actually decent but it seemed most of their good wine picks were just grabbed from Oenopole's wine list, so there was really nothing new there for me.  Their deviled eggs were decent.  The aioli was okay.  They were cooked to perfection and had herring flakes and chives on top as a substitution for salt and to add to the complexity of the dish.  Regardless though, they were just some deviled eggs that tasted a little like fishy salt.  I've also seen this exact dish and presentation two other places before so in all honesty, it was actually quite boring.  When our dover sole fish with accompaniments arrived we were shocked to find the portions of the meal so tiny.  There was a pittance of rice and green beans.  The rice was drenched in butter and seemed to have tiny speckles of pepper in it and nothing else (of course Foiegwa described it as a pilaf on the menu..) and the green beans were undercooked and also slathered in butter.  I actually had trouble slicing through them with a knife in order to eat them.  The fish itself, while cooked to perfection, was also pretty boring and presented with no garnish other than the slightly yellowed sauce it was sitting in.  Of course this sauce was basically nothing more than.. (you guessed it) butter! Atmospherically, I do like the way Foiegwa was decorated.  It was really loud, however, and we were placed at a table that seemed to get bumped by the wait staff on numerous occasions.  I was sort of blown away at how loud it was in there given the music was actually being played at a minimal volume. All-in-all I definitely don't recommend this place.  They won't do a great job of waiting on you, nor feeding you.  Most likely, they will simply gouge your wallet without much of a 'why'.  While Foiegwa is the new face in town (most likely from the same owners as many others I suspect) they're going to have to try a little harder to earn their keep. If you hadn't gathered, I'll tell you anyways, I definitely won't be returning.

Location: super close to Atwater marketIt's a really cute old school dinner with a new twist. The name, as it implies, indicates that you can add foie gras to any dish for $9.95! Because I went for breakfast, I didn't try this. It's a relatively small place so going a little earlier would probably be best to avoid lines. My sister and I went at around 11:30 AM and got a spot right away, but the place was already pretty filled and it was a freezing cold day. I ordered the ham eggs benedict - a classic and always good. Next time I'd probably want to try the truffle spaghetti, it sounded amazing! My sister opted for something more original and got the roasted vegetables and goat cheese tart. It was very beautifully plated and quite delicious. This is definitely somewhere I'd want to try again!

Phenomenal meal! I had the roti (which tastes like a latke topped with salmon). It was so incredible! My husband had the chicken and waffles, which he said was good, but he didn't rant or rave as nearly as much as I did. Very cute restaurant right across the street from Atwater market. Nice service and ambiance.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place!If you've ever heard someone call a restaurant an "upscale diner", this is the place they're talking about. The setting is very reminiscent of a Times Square NY diner, with caricatures on the walls, booths, and even milkshakes on the menu. The difference being - this place is super clean and very contemporary. To get the boring stuff out of the way first - the place is impeccably clean. It looked as if it had just opened for the first time that evening. The fixtures are a bright chrome, and the booths are a nice brown leather finish. The plants are bright and well placed, without being in the way.The staff is incredibly nice and accommodating. We came in as a large party that arrived in 2 waves, and they seated us in a booth in the corner with no problem. The hostess was very charming and nice. Our waiter was super funny and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu. Also of note, we had no french speakers in our party, and that was no problem as the staff did speak English as well as French.I ordered 2 cocktails. The Ponytail and the Cinco De Mayo. Both were quite delicious.  I'd recommend the Ponytail for anyone looking for a bright, citrusy cocktail, and the Cinco De Mayo for anyone who likes a drink with spice. The chili in that drink came through in a great way. I had a friend who got a boozy milkshake, and that was also excellent. The menu is a great variation between classic diner food and high end cuisine. You can get a bowl of black truffle pasta or a plate of fried chicken. Seeing that we came in for drinks and snacks, I ended up going with the chicken liver pate, which was delicious. We also tried the frog's legs, which had a great flavor.Of note: the bar is a bit small, so don't be surprised if you have to get a table - but the drinks and snacks will make that worth it. Overall this was a great experience, and I would certainly come here again. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for late night eats and a good cocktail.
Very good food and ambiance for a date night! Everything tastes so good. Would like to come back again!

I came here for dinner with my family who came down to visit! I love the concept of being able to add foie gras to any of their dishes. Their foie gras was really fresh. Their beef tartare is to DIE FOR! It's delicious and their small size is the perfect amount because if we had gotten the large we would have been way too overwhelmed. We also got the deep-fried frog legs which were pretty good as well. Their spaghetti with the egg is also a must try! It was really good especially if you break the egg yolk first and mix it with the rest of your spaghetti. The mussels in the red sauce were also quite delicious. I'm not a super huge fan of French food since I find it too heavy for my taste but you should definitely come here at least once in your life!
Very nice staff, Aesthetic atmosphere, small weight time, and they payed attention to detail. They didn't rush us to finish even though they were busy and our food was delicious!

Really enjoyed this spot. Reasonable wait times 20 minutes or so and steps to the Atwater market to use up the time just be sure not to stray farther than 5 minutes and to answer your phone as they will give up your spot.The one star off is for our drink order being way late (however both cocktails were great when they came after our food and the waitress gave us to go coffee cups)The confit duck omelette and smoked salmon rosti were great and ample portions. This isn't a super cheap breakfast joint so expect to pay for the ingredients on offer. I'd go back happily!
